title: Rove scores new breakfast show
text:
Rove McManus confirmed as host of Sydney breakfast show on 2DAY news.com.au Rove McManus confirmed as host of Sydney breakfast show on 2DAY news.com.au Rove McManus confirmed as host of Sydney breakfast show on 2DAY. 
IT what was one of the worst kept secrets in radio, Rove McManus has been confirmed as the new host of Sydney breakfast on the Hit Network’s 2Day FM. 
The Gold Logie winner has thumped the station’s current breakfast show hosts Dan and Maz — who have been struggling to make ground since taking over this year — out of the slot. 
While the network has not confirmed a co-host or start date for the 41-year-old comedian and TV host, it’s assumed the new show will be rolled out in 2016 to match the launch of several other new breakfast shows. 
2DAY has struggled to gain back the audience it lost when The Kyle & Jackie O show defected to rival KIIS 1065 (formerly Mix) at the end of 2013. 
Initially replaced with Jules Lund, Merrick Watts and Sophie Monk who failed to make an impression, The Dan & Maz Show hasn’t managed to bring the ratings back either — pulling in a disappointing 3.1 per cent audience share in the latest FM radio ratings. 
But Guy Dobson, Executive Director of Metro Operations at Southern Cross Austereo (2DAY’s parent company), says McManus is just the personality the station needs to bring it back. Other Stories
